page.title: 02FAIRLIGHT AREA, EAST SUSSEX
page.content:
The eastern edge of Hastings, Fairlight, Guestling and Pett, East Sussex are rural areas. There are many farms here and many small natural woodlands. The steep slopes, common in this area, make some of the land unsuitable for cultivation and this is usually left as natural woodland.
There are steep slopes either side of several streams as they reach the coast. Away from the coast the undulating landscape is both useful for the farmer and attractive to the tourist.
The one main road through this area, the A.259, takes a heavy traffic load as it is the main coastal route to the cross-Channel ports of Folkstone and Dover to the east, and Newhaven to the west.
